rm(list = ls())

## Load libraries

```{r}
# | echo: true
# | eval: true

# load libraries
library("tidyverse")
library(RColorBrewer)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggridges)
library(RColorBrewer)

```

## Load data

```{r}
# | echo: true
# | eval: true

# Loading file
body_measurements <- read_tsv(file = "../data/PCOS_body_measurements_aug.tsv")

```

# Metadata analysis

First part of this project, is to see if there is a correlation between patients with PCOS using the metadata.

## Correlation between BMI and PCOS

```{r}
# | echo: true
# | eval: true

body_measurements |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x=patient_ID, y = BMI, color = PCOS_diagnosis)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = 0.8)+
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "PuRd")
  labs(x = "BMI", 
       y = "",
       title = "BMI correlation",
       fill = "PCOS diagnosis")

```

## Correlation between PCOS and cycle category

```{r}
# | echo: true
# | eval: true

body_measurements |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x=age, y = cycle_RI, color = PCOS_diagnosis)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = 0.9)+
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "PuRd")
  labs(x = "BMI", 
       y = "",
       title = "Cycle - regular or irregular",
       fill = "PCOS diagnosis")

```

## Waist-hip ratio and PCOS diagnosis

```{r}
# | echo: true
# | eval: true


body_measurements |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(y = waist_hip_ratio, color = PCOS_diagnosis)) + 
  geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.8)+
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "PuRd")
  labs(x = "BMI", 
       y = "",
       title = "Waist correlation",
       fill = "PCOS diagnosis")

```
